title: Drawing, "Study for "Venus"", ca. 1885
medium: Black crayon, white chalk, on tan paper
provenance: Gift of the American Academy of Arts and Letters
creditline: Gift of the American Academy of Arts and Letters
description:
Bust-length nude figure of a girl, facing  the spectator. Her arms are upraised, in the act of arranging her hair. Signed and inscribed in pencil, lower right: "E. Vedder study / for Venus (ceiling detail)."

(refers to Collis P. Huntington ceiling, commissioned Aug. 1892, finished by Sept 1893, now at Yale)

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study for "Venus"", ca. 1885.
ca. 1885. Black crayon, white chalk, on tan paper. Gift of the American Academy of Arts and Letters. 1955-38-68.
